title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 1. The Optical Registration Board Approved Qualifications Bye-Law
text_raw:
1. The Optical Registration Board Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 
2019 (S.I. No. 228 of 2019) is hereby revoked with effect from the date 
specified in paragraph 2(2), without prejudice to any applications for 
registration or restoration received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 optical registration board approved qualification bye-law 2019 (s.i no 228 2019) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph 2(2) without prejudice application registration restoration received board prior date

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Optical Registration Board
text_raw:
2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Optical Registration Board 

Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 2020. 

(2) The bye-law comes into operation on 6th February 2020.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited optical registration board approved qualification bye-law 2020 (2) bye-law come operation 6th february 2020

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: In the bye-law –
text_raw:
3. 

In the bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 
(No. 27 of 2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“General Division” means the General Division of the register of 
Dispensing Opticians established under section 36(1) of the Act; 

“the Register of Dispensing Opticians” means the register of Dispensing 
Opticians established under section 36(1) of the Act. 

“the Register of Optometrists” means the register of Optometrists 
established under section 36(1) of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no 27 2005) (as amended time time) general division mean general division register dispensing optician established section 36(1) act register dispensing optician mean register dispensing optician established section 36(1) act register optometrist mean register optometrist established section 36(1) act

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 4. The Optical Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(A) of
text_raw:
4. The Optical Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(A) of 
the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to the 
standard of proficiency required for registration in the General Division of the 
Register of Dispensing Opticians: 

(1) Bachelor of Science in Ophthalmic Dispensing, Dublin Institute of 

Technology; and, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th February, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [35] 3 

(2) Bachelor of Science in Ophthalmic Dispensing, Technological 

University Dublin.
text_norm: 4 optical registration board purpose section 38(2)(a) act hereby approves following qualification attesting standard proficiency required registration general division register dispensing optician (1) bachelor science ophthalmic dispensing dublin institute technology notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 11th february 2020 35 3 (2) bachelor science ophthalmic dispensing technological university dublin

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 5. The Optical Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(A)
text_raw:
5. The Optical Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(A) 
of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to the 
standard of proficiency required for registration in the Register of 
Optometrists: 

(1) Bachelor of Science in Optometry, Dublin Institute of Technology; and, 

(2) Bachelor of Science in Optometry, Technological University Dublin. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Optical Registration Board 

 6 February 2020 

SEAMUS BOLAND, 

Chairperson, Optical Registration Board 

and 

PAUL HERSEE, 

Member, Optical Registration Board 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [35]
text_norm: 5 optical registration board purpose section 38(2)(a) act hereby approves following qualification attesting standard proficiency required registration register optometrist (1) bachelor science optometry dublin institute technology (2) bachelor science optometry technological university dublin given seal optical registration board 6 february 2020 seamus boland chairperson optical registration board paul hersee member optical registration board 4 35

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Optical Registration Board as attesting to the standards of 
proficiency required for registration in the General Division of the Register o f 
Dispensing Opticians and those required for registration in the Register of 
Optometrists. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [35] 5
